DescribeAddon.title: DescribeAddon

ModifyClusterAddon.summary: Modifies the configuration of a cluster component. This operation may affect your businesses. We recommend that you assess the impact, back up data, and perform the operation during off-peak hours.

config.title: 自定义参数设置
config.description: The custom parameter settings that you want to use.

ModifyClusterAddon.title: ModifyClusterAddon
ModifyClusterAddon.description:
You can call this API operation to modify the component parameters of an ACK Basic cluster or the control plane parameters of an ACK Pro cluster:

*   To view the component parameters of an ACK Basic cluster, call the DescribeClusterAddonMetadata API operation. For more information, see [Query the metadata of a cluster component](~~2667944~~).
*   To view the control plane parameters of an ACK Pro cluster, see [Customize the control plane parameters of an ACK Pro cluster](~~199588~~).

After you call this operation, the component may be redeployed and restarted. We recommend that you assess the impact before you call this operation.

UpgradeClusterAddons.summary: Updates cluster add-ons to newer versions for enhanced functionality.

next_version.title: 可升级版本
next_version.description: The version to which the component can be updated. You can call the `DescribeClusterAddonsVersion` operation to query the version to which the component can be updated.

version.title: 当前版本
version.description: The current version of the component.

config.title: 组件自定义参数
config.description: The custom component settings that you want to use. The value is a JSON string.

policy.title: 组件升级策略。
policy.description:
The update policy. Valid values:

*   overwrite
*   canary

UpgradeClusterAddons.title: UpgradeClusterAddons

DescribeUserPermission.summary: In an Container Service for Kubernetes (ACK) cluster, you can create and specify different Resource Access Management (RAM) users or roles to have different access permissions. This ensures access control and resource isolation. You can call the DescribeUserPermission operation to query the permissions that are granted to a RAM user or RAM role on ACK clusters, including the resources that are allowed to access, the scope of the permissions, the predefined role, and the permission source.

schema.title: RAM 用户的 UID
schema.description:
The ID of the RAM user or RAM role.

*   If you query RAM user permissions, the UID of the RAM user is used.
*   If you query the permissions of a RAM role, the ID of the RAM role is used.

items.description: The cluster authorization details of the RAM user.

resource_id.title: 集群访问配置
resource_id.description:
The authorization setting. Valid values:

*   `{cluster_id}` is returned if the permissions are scoped to a cluster.
*   `{cluster_id}/{namespace}` is returned if the permissions are scoped to a namespace of a cluster.
*   `all-clusters` is returned if the permissions are scoped to all clusters.

resource_type.title: 授权类型
resource_type.description:
The authorization type. Valid values:

*   `cluster`: indicates that the permissions are scoped to a cluster.
*   `namespace`: indicates that the permissions are scoped to a namespace of a cluster.
*   `console`: indicates that the permissions are scoped to all clusters.

role_name.title: 自定义角色名称
role_name.description: The name of the custom role. If a custom role is assigned, the value is the name of the assigned custom role.

role_type.title: 预置的角色类型
role_type.description:
The type of predefined role. Valid values:

*   `admin`: administrator
*   `ops`: O\&M engineer
*   `dev`: developer
*   `restricted`: restricted user
*   `custom`: custom role

is_owner.title: 是否为集群 owner 的授权
is_owner.description:
Indicates whether the permissions are granted to the cluster owner.

*   `0`: indicates that the permissions are not granted to the cluster owner.
*   `1`: indicates that the permissions are granted to the cluster owner. The cluster owner is the administrator.

is_ram_role.title: 是否为ram 角色授权
is_ram_role.description:
Indicates whether the permissions are granted to the RAM role. Valid values:

*   `0`: indicates that the permissions are not granted to the RAM role.
*   `1`: indicates that the permissions are granted to the RAM role.

DescribeUserPermission.title: DescribeUserPermission
DescribeUserPermission.description:
**Precautions**:

*   If you call this operation as a Resource Access Management (RAM) user or by assuming a RAM role, only the permissions granted on the clusters on which the current account has the role-based access control (RBAC) administrator permissions are returned. If you want to query the permissions on all clusters, you must use an account that has the RBAC administrator permissions on all clusters.
DescribeUserPermission.responseParamsDescription: The parent_id parameter is deprecated. Do not use this parameter.

GrantPermissions.summary: By default, RAM users or roles who aren't cluster creators and haven't been granted full cluster permissions have no RBAC permissions in the cluster. You can call this interface to update RBAC access permissions for RAM users/roles, including accessible resources, permission scopes, and preset roles, for enhanced security control on resources in Container Service for Kubernetes (ACK) clusters.

schema.title: 指定 RAM 用户的 UID
schema.description: The ID of the RAM user or RAM role whose permissions you want to update.

items.description: The queried permissions.

cluster.title: 授权目标集群id
cluster.description:
The ID of the cluster on which you want to grant permissions to the RAM role or RAM role.

*   Set this parameter to an empty string if `role_type` is set to `all-clusters`.

is_custom.title: 该授权是否是自定义授权
is_custom.description: Specifies whether to assign a custom role to the RAM user or RAM role. If you want to assign a custom role to the RAM user or RAM role, set `role_name` to the name of the custom role.

role_name.title: 预置的角色名称
role_name.description:
The predefined role name. Valid values:

*   `admin`: administrator
*   `admin-view`: read-only administrator
*   `ops`: O\&M engineer
*   `dev`: developer
*   `restricted`: restricted user
*   Custom role

Note:

*   You cannot grant namespace-level permissions to the `admin`, `admin-view`, and `ops` roles.
*   You cannot grant all cluster-level permissions to the `admin-view` role.

role_type.title: 授权类型
role_type.description:
The authorization type. Valid values:

*   `cluster`: authorizes the RAM user or RAM role to manage the specified clusters.
*   `namespace`: authorizes the RAM user or RAM role to manage the specified namespaces.
*   `all-clusters`: authorizes the RAM user or RAM role to manage all clusters.

namespace.title: 命名空间名称
namespace.description: The namespace that you want to authorize the RAM user or RAM role to manage. This parameter is required only if you set role_type to namespace.

is_ram_role.title: 是否是 RAM 角色授权
is_ram_role.description: Specifies whether to use a RAM role to grant permissions.

GrantPermissions.title: GrantPermissions
GrantPermissions.description:
*   If you use a Resource Access Management (RAM) account to call this operation, make sure it has permissions to modify cluster authorization information for other RAM users or RAM roles. Otherwise, the `StatusForbidden` or `ForbiddenGrantPermissions` error code is returned. For more information, see [Use a RAM user to grant RBAC permissions to other RAM users](~~119035~~).
*   This operation overwrites all existing cluster permissions for the target RAM user or RAM role. You must specify all the permissions you want to grant to the RAM user or RAM role in the request.

UpdateUserPermissions.summary: In a Container Service for Kubernetes (ACK) cluster, non-cluster creators, Resource Access Management (RAM) users, and RAM roles do not have any Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) permissions in the cluster by default. You can call this operation to specify the resources that can be accessed, permission scope, and predefined roles. This helps you better manage the access control on resources in ACK clusters.

schema.description: The ID of the RAM user or RAM role whose permissions you want to update.

items.description: The request parameters.

cluster.description:
The ID of the cluster on which you want to grant permissions to the RAM role or RAM role.

*   Set this parameter to an empty string if `role_type` is set to `all-clusters`.

is_custom.description: Specifies whether to assign a custom role to the RAM user or RAM role. If you want to assign a custom role to the RAM user or RAM role, set `role_name` to the name of the custom role.

role_name.description:
The predefined role name. Valid values:

*   `admin`: administrator
*   `admin-view`: read-only administrator
*   `ops`: O\&M engineer
*   `dev`: developer
*   `restricted`: restricted user
*   Custom role

Note:

*   You cannot grant **namespace-level** permissions to the `admin`, `admin-view`, and `ops` roles.
*   You cannot grant **all cluster-level** permissions to the `admin-view` role.

role_type.description:
The authorization type. Valid values:

*   `cluster`: authorizes the RAM user or RAM role to manage the specified clusters.
*   `namespace`: authorizes the RAM user or RAM role to manage the specified namespaces.
*   `all-clusters`: authorizes the RAM user or RAM role to manage all clusters.

namespace.description: The namespace that you want to authorize the RAM user or RAM role to manage. This parameter is required only if you set role_type to namespace.

is_ram_role.description: Specifies whether to use a RAM role to grant permissions.

schema.description:
The authorization method. Valid values:

*   `apply`: The global update mode. Overwrites all existing permissions of the RAM user or RAM role on the cluster. You must specify all the permissions you want to grant to the RAM user or RAM role in the request parameters when you call this operation.
*   `delete`: The deletion mode. Revokes only the cluster permissions specified in the request, preserving other existing permissions of the RAM user or RAM role.
*   `patch`: The incremental mode. Adds only the cluster permissions specified in the request, preserving other existing permissions of the RAM user or RAM role.

Default value: `apply`.

UpdateUserPermissions.title: UpdateUserPermissions
UpdateUserPermissions.description:
**Precautions**:

*   You can update the permissions of a RAM user or RAM role on a cluster by using full update or incremental update. If you use full update, the existing permissions of the RAM user or RAM role on the cluster are overwritten. You must specify all the permissions that you want to grant to the RAM user or RAM role in the request parameters when you call the operation. If you use incremental update, you can grant permissions to or revoke permissions from the RAM user or RAM role on the cluster. In this case, only the permissions that you specify in the request parameters when you call the operation are granted or revoked, other permissions of the RAM user or RAM role on the cluster are not affected.

CheckServiceRole.summary: Checks whether the specified service roles are granted to Container Service for Kubernetes (ACK) within the current Alibaba Cloud account. ACK can access other cloud services, such as Elastic Compute Service (ECS), Object Storage Service (OSS), File Storage NAS (NAS), and Server Load Balancer (SLB), only after ACK is assigned the required service roles.

roles.title: 需要检查的角色列表
roles.description: The list of service roles you want to check.

items.description: The information about a service role.

name.title: 角色名称
name.description: The server role name. For more information about the service roles and their permissions in ACK, see [ACK roles](~~86483~~).

items.description: The service roles.

name.title: 角色名称
name.description: The name of the service role.

granted.title: 是否已授权
granted.description:
Indicates whether the service role is assigned to ACK.

Valid values:

*   true: The role is assigned to ACK.
*   false: The role is not assigned to ACK.

message.title: 未授权时的提示信息
message.description: The message that is displayed for a role that is not assigned to ACK.
message.example: The role does not exist: AliyunCSManagedAutoScalerRole

CheckServiceRole.title: CheckServiceRole

ScanClusterVuls.summary: Scans for vulnerabilities in a Container Service for Kubernetes (ACK) cluster, including workload vulnerabilities, third-party software vulnerabilities, CVE vulnerabilities, WebCMS vulnerabilities, and Windows vulnerabilities. We recommend that you scan your cluster on a regular basis to ensure cluster security.
ScanClusterVuls.title: ScanClusterVuls

DescribeClusterVuls.summary: Queries the security vulnerability details of a cluster by cluster ID. The details include vulnerability name, vulnerability type, and vulnerability severity. We recommend that you scan your cluster on a regular basis to ensure cluster security.

items.description: Details of a vulnerability.

nodepool_name.description: The name of the node pool.

node_count.description: The number of nodes that have the vulnerability.

vul_type.description:
The type of vulnerability.

Valid values:

*   app: application vulnerabilities
*   sca: application vulnerabilities (software component analysis)
*   cve: Linux vulnerabilities
*   cms: Web-CMS vulnerabilities
*   sys: Windows vulnerabilities
*   emg:  emergency vulnerabilities

necessity.description:
The severity level of the vulnerability.

Valid values:

*   nntf: low
*   later: medium     
*   asap: high

items.description: The CVE information.

DescribeClusterVuls.title: DescribeClusterVuls

UpdateResourcesDeleteProtection.summary: Updates the deletion protection status of the specified resources. You can enable or disable deletion protection for namespaces and Services. You can call this operation to enable deletion protection for namespaces or Services that involve businesses-critical and sensitive data to avoid incurring maintenance costs caused by accidental namespace or Service deletion.

schema.description: The request body that specifies the status of deletion protection for the specified resource.

namespace.description: The namespace to which the resource belongs.

resource_type.description: The type of resource for which deletion protection is enabled or disabled. You can specify namespaces or Services.

items.description: The name of the resource.

enable.description: Specifies whether to enable deletion protection. Set the value to true to enable deletion protection and set the value to false to disable deletion protection.

namespace.description: The namespace to which the resource belongs.

resource_type.description: The type of resource for which deletion protection is enabled or disabled.

resources.description: The list of resources whose deletion protection status is updated.

items.description: The name of the resource whose deletion protection status is updated.

protection.description: Indicates the status of deletion protection. A value of true indicates that deletion protection is enabled and a value of false indicates that deletion protection is disabled.

UpdateResourcesDeleteProtection.title: UpdateResourcesDeleteProtection

DescribeResourcesDeleteProtection.summary: Queries whether the deletion protection feature is enabled for the specified resources in the cluster. The resources that you can query include namespaces and Services.

schema.description: The ID of the Container Service for Kubernetes (ACK) cluster.

The type of the resource that you want to query. Valid values:

*   Namespaces
*   services

The namespace in which the resources that you want to query reside.

This parameter is required when you set resource_type to services. Default value: default.

The names of the resources that you want to query. Separate multiple resource names with commas (,).

*   When you set resource_type to namespaces, you must specify namespace names. If you leave this parameter empty, all namespaces in the cluster are queried.
*   If you set resource_type to services, you must specify Service names.
The status of deletion protection for the specified resources.

namespace.description: The namespace to which the resource belongs.

protection.description:
Indicates whether deletion protection is enabled.

*   true: deletion protection is enabled.
*   false: deletion protection is disabled.

DescribeResourcesDeleteProtection.title: DescribeResourcesDeleteProtection

DeployPolicyInstance.summary: Deploys a policy in the specified namespaces of a specific Container Service for Kubernetes (ACK) cluster. You can create and deploy a security policy by specifying the policy type, action of the policy such as alerting or denying, and namespaces to which the policy applies.

action.title: 规则治理动作
action.description:
The action of the policy. Valid values:

*   `deny`: Deployments that match the policy are denied.
*   `warn`: Alerts are generated for Deployments that match the policy.

namespaces.title: 限制策略实施的命名空间，为空时表示所有命名空间
namespaces.description: The namespaces to which the policy applies. If you leave this parameter empty, the policy is applicable to all namespaces of the cluster.

items.description: The namespaces to which the policy applies. If you leave this parameter empty, the policy is applicable to all namespaces of the cluster.

parameters.title: 当前规则实例的配置参数
parameters.description: The parameter settings of the policy. For more information about the parameters supported by each policy, see [Predefined security policies of ACK](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/doc-detail/359819.html).

items.description: The policy instances that are deployed.

action.title: 规则治理动作
action.description:
The action of the policy. Valid values:

*   `deny`: Deployments that match the policy are denied.
*   `warn`: Alerts are generated for deployments that match the policy.

instance_name.title: 策略规则实例id
instance_name.description: The ID of the policy instance.

namespaces.title: 限制策略实施的命名空间，为空时表示所有命名空间
namespaces.description: The namespaces to which the policy is applied. The policy is applied to all namespaces if this parameter is left empty.

A value of "" indicates all namespaces in the cluster. This is the default value.

DescribePolicies.summary: Queries a list of security policies. Container Service for Kubernetes (ACK) clusters offer a variety of built-in container security policies, such as Compliance, Infra, K8s-general, and pod security policy (PSP). You can use these policies to ensure the security of containers running in a production environment.

schema.title: 系统支持的所有策略模板。key为策略类型，value为该策略类型下的所有策略模板名称列表
schema.description: The list of the returned policies. The key of each entry indicates the type of the policy. The value of each entry indicates the names of the policies of the corresponding type.

additionalProperties.description: The list of the names of policy templates of each type.

items.title: 策略模板名称
items.description: For more information about policies, see [Predefined security policies of ACK](~~359819~~).

DescribePolicies.title: DescribePolicies

DescribePolicyDetails.summary: Queries the detailed information about a policy. The information includes the content, action, and severity level of the policy. Container Service for Kubernetes (ACK) provides the following types of predefined security policies: Compliance, Infra, K8s-general, and pod security policy (PSP). These policies ensure that containers are running in the production environment in a secure manner.

description.title: 规则模板描述
description.example: Requires container images to begin with a repo string from a specified list

action.title: 规则治理动作 ● enforce: 拦截违规部署 ● inform：告警
action.description:
The action of the policy. Valid values:

*   `enforce`: blocks deployments that match the policy.
*   `inform`: generates alerts for deployments that match the policy.

severity.title: 规则治理等级
severity.description:
The severity level of the policy. Valid values:

*   `high`
*   `medium`
*   `low`

template.title: 规则模板详情
template.example: For more information, see sample requests.

no_config.title: 是否需要配置策略： 0表示需要参数配置 1表示无需参数配置
no_config.description:
Indicates whether parameters are required. Valid values:

*   0: Parameters are required.
*   1: Parameters are optional.

is_deleted.title: 软删除标志：0表示未删除 1表示删除
is_deleted.description:
Indicates whether the policy is deleted. Valid values:

*   0: The policy is not deleted.
*   1: The policy is deleted.

DescribePolicyGovernanceInCluster.summary: Container Service for Kubernetes (ACK) clusters offer a variety of built-in container security policies, such as Compliance, Infra, K8s-general, and pod security policy (PSP). You can use these policies to ensure the security of containers running in a production environment. You can call the DescribePolicyGovernanceInCluster operation to query the details of policies for an ACK cluster. For example, you can query the number of policies that are enabled per severity level, the audit logs of policies, and the blocking and alerting information.

on_state.title: 当前集群中开启的不同等级策略计数统计

severity.title: 策略治理等级
severity.description: The severity level of the policy.

admit_log.title: 集群当前策略治理审计日志
admit_log.description: The audit logs of the policies in the cluster.

progress.title: 查询结果的状态
progress.description:
The status of the query. Valid values:

*   `Complete`: The query succeeded and the complete query result is returned.
*   `Incomplete`: The query succeeded but the query result is incomplete. To obtain the complete query result, you must repeat the request.

count.description: The number of audit log entries.

DescribePolicyGovernanceInCluster.title: DescribePolicyGovernanceInCluster

DescribePolicyInstances.summary: Queries the detailed information about policy instances of the specified type in a Container Service for Kubernetes (ACK) cluster, such as the policy description and severity level. You can choose a type of security policy for an ACK cluster, specify the action and applicable scope of the policy, and then create and deploy a policy instance.

schema.title: 策略类型
schema.description: The name of the policy that you want to query.

schema.title: 策略实例名称
schema.description: The name of the policy instance that you want to query.

items.description: The policy instance.

ali_uid.title: 策略实例实施者UID
ali_uid.description: The UID of the Alibaba Cloud account that is used to deploy the policy instance.

instance_name.title: 规则实例名称
instance_name.description: The name of the policy instance.

policy_description.title: 规则模板描述
policy_description.description: The description of the policy template.
policy_description.example: Restricts secrets used in pod envs

policy_parameters.title: 当前规则实例的配置参数
policy_parameters.description: The parameters of the policy instance.

policy_severity.title: 规则实例治理等级
policy_severity.description: The severity level of the policy instance.

policy_scope.title: 策略实例实施范围： 默认"*"代表集群所有ns 否则返回作用namespaces名称，多个namespaces以逗号分隔
policy_scope.description:
The applicable scope of the policy instance.

A value of \* indicates all namespaces in the cluster. This is the default value.

Multiple namespaces are separated by commas (,).

policy_action.title: 规则治理动作  deny: 拦截违规部署  warn：告警
policy_action.description:
The action of the policy. Valid values:

*   `deny`: Deployments that match the policy are denied.
*   `warn`: Alerts are generated for deployments that match the policy.

Created.title: 创建时间
Created.description: The creation time of the instance. This parameter is deprecated.

Updated.title: 更新时间
Updated.description: The update time of the instance. This parameter is deprecated.

resource_id.title: 资源ID
resource_id.description: The ID of the resource. This parameter is deprecated.

total_violations.title: 集群中处理违规计数
total_violations.description: The number of violations processed in the cluster. This parameter is deprecated.

is_deleted.title: 删除状态
is_deleted.description: The status of the deletion. This parameter is deprecated.

DescribePolicyInstances.title: DescribePolicyInstances

DescribePolicyInstancesStatus.summary: Queries the deployment of policy instances in the current Container Service for Kubernetes (ACK) cluster, including the number of policy instances of each type and the number of policy types of each severity level.

policy_instances.title: 不同策略类型下的策略实例计数列表
policy_instances.description: The number of policy instances of each policy type.

policy_category.description: The type of the policy. For more information about different types of policies and their descriptions, see [Predefined security policies of ACK](~~359819~~).

policy_description.example: Restricts use of the cluster-admin role.

policy_severity.description: The severity level of the policy.

policy_instances_count.description: The number of policy instances that are deployed. If this parameter is empty, no policy instance is deployed.

instances_severity_count.description: The number of policy instances that are deployed in the cluster at different severity levels.

RunClusterCheck.summary: Container Intelligence Service (CIS) provides a variety of cluster check capabilities to allow you to perform cluster update check, cluster migration check, component installation check, component update check, and node pool check. A precheck is automatically triggered before an update, migration, or installation is performed. You can perform changes only if the cluster passes the precheck. You can also manually call the RunClusterCheck operation to initiate cluster checks. We recommend that you periodically check and maintain your cluster to mitigate potential risks.

type.title: 检查类型。
type.description:
The check type.

Valid values:

*   ClusterMigrate: cluster migration.
*   MasterUpgrade: control plane upgrade.
*   NodePoolUpgrade: node pool upgrade.
*   ClusterUpgrade: cluster upgrade.

target.title: 检查的对象。
target.description:
The check target.

If you set `type=NodePoolUpgrade`, you must set this parameter to the node pool ID. Otherwise, this parameter is optional.

check_id.title: 检查ID。
check_id.description: The ID of the cluster check task.

RunClusterCheck.title: RunClusterCheck

ListClusterChecks.summary: You can call the ListClusterChecks operation to query all the cluster check results of a cluster.

check_id.title: 检查ID。
check_id.description: The ID of the cluster check task.

type.title: 检查类型。
type.description: The check method.

status.title: 检查状态。
status.description: The status of the cluster check.

message.title: 检查状态信息。
message.description: The message that indicates the status of the cluster check task.

created_at.title: 创建时间。
created_at.description: The time when the cluster check task was created.

finished_at.title: 完成时间。
finished_at.description: The time when the cluster check task was completed.

ListClusterChecks.title: ListClusterChecks

GetClusterCheck.summary: Queries a cluster check task by cluster ID and task ID. You can view the status, check items, creation time, and end time of the task. Container Intelligence Service (CIS) provides a variety of Kubernetes cluster check features, including cluster update check, cluster migration check, component installation check, component update check, and node pool check.

schema.title: 检查ID。
schema.description: The ID of the cluster check task. You can call the [RunClusterCheck](~~2667902~~) operation to obtain the check_id.

check_id.title: Id of the request
check_id.description: The ID of the cluster check task.

type.title: 检查类型。
type.description: The check method.

CreateTemplate.summary: Creates an orchestration template. An orchestration template defines and describes a group of Kubernetes resources. It declaratively describes the configuration of an application or how an application runs. You can use orchestration templates to manage resources in Kubernetes clusters and automate resource deployment, such as pods, Services, Deployments, ConfigMaps, and persistent volumes (PVs).

name.title: 模板名称。
name.description:
The name of the orchestration template.

The name must be 1 to 63 characters in length, and can contain digits, letters, and hyphens (-). It cannot start with a hyphen (-).

template.title: YAML格式的模板内容。
template.description: The template content in the YAML format.

template_type.title: 模板类型。默认值：kubernetes
template_type.description:
The template type.

*   If the parameter is set to `kubernetes`, the template is displayed on the Templates page in the console.
*   If this parameter is not specified or the value is set to another value, the template is not displayed on the Orchestration Template page in the console.

We recommend that you set the parameter to `kubernetes`.

template_id.title: 模板ID。
template_id.description: The ID of the orchestration template.

CreateTemplate.title: CreateTemplate

DescribeTemplateAttribute.summary: An orchestration template defines and describes a group of Kubernetes resources. It declaratively describes the configuration of an application or how an application runs. You can call the DescribeTemplates API operation to query orchestration templates and their detailed information, including access permissions, YAML content, and labels.

schema.title: 模板类型，值为创建部署模板时指定的模板类型。
schema.description:
The type of template. The value can be a custom value.

*   If the parameter is set to `kubernetes`, the template is displayed on the Templates page in the console.
*   If the parameter is set to `compose`, the template is displayed on the Container Service - Swarm page in the console. Container Service for Swarm is deprecated.
*   If the value of the parameter is not `kubernetes`, the template is not displayed on the Templates page in the console. We recommend that you set the parameter to `kubernetes`.

Default value: `kubernetes`.

schema.title: 返回参数。
schema.description: The details of the queried template.

id.title: 编排模板ID，模板每次修改，这个ID都会改变。
id.description: The ID of the template. When you update a template, a new template ID is generated.

acl.title: 编排模板权限。取值：private，public，shared。
acl.description: The access control policy of the template.

template.title: 编排模板内容。
template.description: The template content in the YAML format.

template_type.title: 编排模板类型
template_type.description:
The type of template. The value can be a custom value.

*   If the parameter is set to `kubernetes`, the template is displayed on the Templates page in the console.
*   If the parameter is set to `compose`, the template is displayed on the Container Service - Swarm page in the console. Container Service for Swarm is deprecated.
*   If the value of the parameter is not `kubernetes`, the template is not displayed on the Templates page in the console. We recommend that you set the parameter to `kubernetes`.

Default value: `kubernetes`.

template_with_hist_id.title: 编排模板ID，该ID唯一不随更新而改变。
template_with_hist_id.description: The unique ID of the template. The value remains unchanged after the template is updated.

created.title: 编排模板创建时间。
created.description: The time when the template was created.

updated.title: 编排模板修改时间。
updated.description: The time when the template was updated.

DescribeTemplateAttribute.title: DescribeTemplateAttribute

DescribeTemplates.summary: An orchestration template defines and describes a group of Kubernetes resources. It declaratively describes the configuration of an application or how an application runs. You can call the DescribeTemplates API operation to query orchestration templates and their detailed information, including access permissions, YAML content, and labels.

schema.title: 模板类型，部署模板类型，目前一共有2种类型，取值为：kubernetes或compose。
schema.description:
The type of template. This parameter can be set to a custom value.

*   If the parameter is set to `kubernetes`, the template is displayed on the Templates page in the console.
*   If you set the parameter to `compose`, the template is not displayed on the Templates page in the console.

Default value: `kubernetes`.

schema.title: 对查询结果进行分页处理，指定返回第几页的数据。  默认值为 1
对查询结果进行分页处理，指定每页包含的数据条数。  默认值为 10
schema.description:
The number of entries per page.

Default value: 10.

acl.title: 模板访问权限，取值为：private、pubilc或shared。。
acl.description:
The access control policy of the template. Valid values:

*   `private`: The template is private.
*   `public`: The template is public.
*   `shared`: The template can be shared.

Default value: `private`.

id.title: 模板ID。会模板随着更新而变化。

tags.title: 模板标签，如果不显式指定了，默认为模板名称。
tags.description: The label of the template. By default, the value is the name of the template.

template.title: 模板详情。
template.description: The template content in the YAML format.
template.example:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: nginx-deployment-basic
  labels:
    app: nginx
spec:
  replicas: 2
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: nginx
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: nginx
    spec:
      containers:
      - name: nginx
        image: busybox:latest
        ports:
        - containerPort: 80

template_type.title: 部署模板类型。
template_type.description:
The type of template. This parameter can be set to a custom value.

*   If the parameter is set to `kubernetes`, the template is displayed on the Templates page in the console.
*   If the parameter is set to `compose`, the template is displayed on the Container Service - Swarm page in the console. However, Container Service for Swarm is deprecated.

created.title: 模板创建时间。
created.description: The time when the template was created.

updated.title: 模板修改时间。
updated.description: The time when the template was updated.

template_with_hist_id.title: 模板唯一ID。
template_with_hist_id.description: The ID of the parent template. The value of `template_with_hist_id` is the same for each template version. This allows you to manage different template versions.

page_size.title: 单页最大数据条数。
page_size.description: The number of entries per page.

total_count.title: 结果总数。
total_count.description: The total number of entries returned.

UpdateTemplate.summary: Updates the configurations of an orchestration template. An orchestration template defines and describes a group of Container Service for Kubernetes (ACK) resources. An orchestration template describes the configurations of an application or how an application runs in a declarative manner.

template.title: 部署模板yaml。
template.description: The YAML content of the template.
template.example: apiVersion: apps/v1\\nkind: Deployment\\nmetadata:\\n  name: nginx-deployment-basic\\n  labels:\\n    app: nginx\\nspec:\\n  replicas: 2\\n  selector:\\n    matchLabels:\\n      app: nginx\\n  template:\\n    metadata:\\n      labels:\\n        app: nginx\\n    spec:\\n      containers:\\n      - name: nginx\\n        image: busybox:latest\\n        ports:\\n        - containerPort: 8080

template_type.title: 部署模板类型。
template_type.description:
The type of template. This parameter can be set to a custom value.

*   If the parameter is set to `kubernetes`, the template is displayed on the Templates page in the console.
*   If the parameter is set to `compose`, the template is displayed on the Container Service - Swarm page in the console. Container Service for Swarm is deprecated.

UpdateTemplate.title: UpdateTemplate

CreateTrigger.summary: Creates a trigger for an application to redeploy the application pods when specific conditions are met.

project_id.title: 项目名称。
project_id.description:
The name of the trigger project.

The name consists of the namespace where the application is deployed and the name of the application. The format is `${namespace}/${name}`.

Example: `default/test-app`.

action.title: 触发器行为
action.description:
The action that the trigger performs. Set the value to redeploy.

`redeploy`: redeploys the resources specified by `project_id`.

type.title: 触发器类型。默认deployment。
type.description:
The type of trigger. Valid values:

*   `deployment`: performs actions on Deployments.
*   `application`: performs actions on applications that are deployed in Application Center.

Default value: `deployment`.

project_id.title: 触发器项目名称。
project_id.description: The name of the trigger project.

type.title: 触发器类型。默认值为 deployment 。
type.description: The trigger type.

action.title: 触发器行为。
action.description: The actions performed by the trigger.

CreateTrigger.title: CreateTrigger

DescribeTrigger.summary: Queries triggers that match specific conditions.

schema.title: 应用所属命名空间。
schema.description: The namespace to which the application belongs.

schema.title: 应用类型。
schema.description:
The type of trigger. Valid values:

*   `deployment`: performs actions on Deployments.
*   `application`: performs actions on applications that are deployed in Application Center.

Default value: `deployment`.

If you do not set this parameter, triggers are not filtered by type.

schema.title: 触发器行为。
schema.description:
The action that the trigger performs. Set the value to redeploy.

`redeploy`: redeploys the resources specified by `project_id`.

If you do not specify this parameter, triggers are not filtered by action.

schema.title: 返回参数。
schema.description: The details of the triggers returned.

cluster_id.title: 集群ID
cluster_id.description: The ID of the associated cluster.

project_id.title: 触发器项目名称
project_id.description:
The name of the project.

The name consists of the namespace where the application is deployed and the name of the application. The format is `${namespace}/${name}`. Example: default/test-app.

type.title: 触发器类型。
type.description:
The type of trigger.

Valid values:

*   `deployment`: performs actions on Deployments.
*   `application`: performs actions on applications that are deployed in Application Center.

Default value: `deployment`.

action.title: 触发器行为
action.description:
The action that the trigger performs. The value is set to redeploy.

`redeploy`: redeploys the resource specified by project_id.

You can use labels to classify and manage Container Service for Kubernetes (ACK) clusters in order to meet monitoring, cost analysis, and tenant isolation requirements.

TagResources.summary: You can add labels in key-value pairs to clusters. This allows cluster developers or O\\\&M engineers to classify and manage clusters in a more flexible manner. This also meets the requirements for monitoring, cost analysis, and tenant isolation. You can call the TagResources operation to add labels to a cluster.

items.description: The resource ID. You can specify up to 50 resource IDs.

resource_type.title: 资源类型定义。取值范围：  只支持CLUSTER这一种资源类型
resource_type.description: The type of resources that you want to label. Set the value to `CLUSTER`.

region_id.title: 资源所属的地域ID
region_id.description: The ID of the region in which the resource resides.

tags.title: 资源的标签键值对。数组长度范围：1~20。一旦传值，则不允许为空字符串。最多支持128个字符，不能以aliyun和acs:开头，不能包含http://或者https://。
tags.description:
The tags that you want to add to the resources in key-value pairs. You can add up to 20 key-value pairs. Note:

*   The values cannot be empty strings. A value must be 1 to 128 characters in length.
*   A key or value cannot start with `aliyun` or `acs:`.
*   A key or value cannot contain `http://` or `https://`.

items.description: The resource tags.

UpdateControlPlaneLog.summary: Modifies the log configurations of control plane components. The configurations include the log retention period and components whose logs that you want to collect. Container Service for Kubernetes (ACK) managed clusters can collect the logs of control plane components and deliver the logs to projects in Simple Log Service. These control plane components include Kube-apiserver, kube-scheduler, Kubernetes controller manager, and cloud controller manager (CCM).

log_project.description:
The name of the Simple Log Service Project that you want to use to store the logs of control plane components.

Default value: k8s-log-$Cluster ID.

log_ttl.description:
The retention period of the log data stored in the Logstore. Valid values: 1 to 3000. Unit: days.

Default value: 30.

aliuid.description: The ID of the Alibaba Cloud account.

components.description: The control plane components for which you want to enable log collection.

items.description:
The control plane components for which you want to enable log collection. The following control plane components are supported:

*   `apiserver`
*   `ccm`
*   `scheduler`
*   `kcm`
*   `controlplane-events`
*   `vk`: supported only in Serverless Kubernetes (ASK) clusters.
*   `istio`: supported only in clusters that are associated with Service Mesh (ASM) instances.
*   `cluster-operator`: supported only in clusters that are managed by using Distributed Cloud Container Platform for Kubernetes (ACK One).
*   `application-controller`: supported only in clusters that are managed by using ACK One. By default, log collection is enabled for the following control plane components: `apiserver`, `ccm`, `scheduler`, `kcm`, and `controlplane-events`.

UpdateControlPlaneLog.title: UpdateControlPlaneLog

CheckControlPlaneLogEnable.summary: Queries the current log configuration of control plane components, including the log retention period and the log collection component. Container Service for Kubernetes (ACK) managed clusters can collect the logs of control plane components and deliver the logs to projects in Simple Log Service. These control plane components include Kube API Server, Kube Scheduler, Kube Controller Manager, and Cloud Controller Manager.

log_project.description:
The name of the Simple Log Service project that you want to use to store the logs of control plane components.

Default value: k8s-log-$Cluster ID.

log_ttl.description:
The retention period of the log data stored in the Logstore. Valid values: 1 to 3000. Unit: days.

Default value: 30.

aliuid.description: The ID of the Alibaba Cloud account to which the resource belongs.

components.description: The control plane components for which log collection is enabled.

items.description:
The control plane components for which log collection is enabled.

By default, log collection is enabled for the following control plane components: `apiserver`, `ccm`, `scheduler`, `kcm`, and `controlplane-events`.

CheckControlPlaneLogEnable.title: CheckControlPlaneLogEnable

GetClusterAuditProject.summary: You can call the GetClusterAuditProject operation to check whether the cluster has API Server auditing enabled and the corresponding Simple Log Service project that stores API Server audit logs.

sls_project_name.description: The SLS project in which the audit logs of the API server are stored.

audit_enabled.title: 当前集群是否已启用API Server审计功能。true：已启用，false：未启用。
audit_enabled.description:
Indicates whether the cluster auditing feature is enabled for the cluster. 

* `true`: The cluster auditing feature is enabled for the cluster. 
* `false`: The cluster auditing feature is disabled for the cluster.

GetClusterAuditProject.title: GetClusterAuditProject

UpdateClusterAuditLogConfig.summary: You can call the UpdateClusterAuditLogConfig operation to enable or disable the audit log feature in a Container Service for Kubernetes (ACK) cluster and update the audit log configuration. This operation also allows you to record requests to the Kubernetes API and the responses, which can be used to trace cluster operation history and troubleshoot cluster issues.

sls_project_name.description:
The [Simple Log Service project](~~48873~~) to which the [Logstore](~~48873~~) storing the cluster audit logs belongs.

*   Default value: k8s-log-{clusterid}.
*   After the cluster audit log feature is enabled, a Logstore is created in the specified Simple Log Service project to store cluster audit logs.
*   If you want to change the project after audit logging is enabled for the cluster, you can use this parameter to specify another project. You can perform this operation only in ACK managed clusters.

disable.description:
Enable or disable audit logging.

*   false: enables audit logging or updates the audit logging configurations.
*   true: disables audit logging.

UpdateClusterAuditLogConfig.title: UpdateClusterAuditLogConfig
UpdateClusterAuditLogConfig.description: Before you call this operation, ensure that you understand the billing methods and pricing of [Simple Log Service](https://www.alibabacloud.com/product/log-service/pricing).

DescribeAddons.summary: You can call the DescribeAddons operation to query the details about all components that are supported by Container Service for Kubernetes (ACK).

schema.title: 地域ID。
schema.description: The region ID of the cluster.

schema.title: 集群类型。  - Kubernetes: 专有版集群。 - ManagedKubernetes：托管版集群。 - Ask：Serverless 集群。 - ExternalKubernetes：注册到ACK的外部集群。
schema.description:
*   `Kubernetes`: ACK dedicated cluster.
*   `ManagedKubernetes`: ACK managed cluster. ACK managed clusters include ACK Basic clusters, ACK Pro clusters, ACK Serverless Basic clusters, ACK Serverless Pro clusters, ACK Edge Basic clusters, ACK Edge Pro clusters, and ACK Lingjun Pro clusters.
*   `ExternalKubernetes`: registered cluster.

The cluster type. Valid values:

*   `Default`: ACK managed cluster
*   `Serverless`: ACK Serverless cluster
*   `Edge`: ACK Edge cluster

If you set `cluster_type` to `ManagedKubernetes` and specify `profile`, you can further specify the edition of the cluster. Valid values:

*   `ack.pro.small`: creates an ACK Pro cluster.
*   `ack.standard`: creates an ACK Basic cluster. If you leave the parameter empty, an ACK Basic cluster is created.

ComponentGroups.title: 组件分组信息，例如：存储类组件，网络组件等。
ComponentGroups.description: The list of the returned components.

group_name.title: 组件组名称。
group_name.description: The name of the component group.

items.title: 组件列表
items.description: The names of the components in the component group.

StandardComponents.title: 标准组件信息，包含各个组件的描述信息。

required.title: 是否为必需组件。
required.description:
Indicates whether the component is a required component. Valid values:

*   `true`: The component is required and must be installed when a cluster is created.
*   `false`: The component is optional. After a cluster is created, you can go to the `Add-ons` page to install the component.

disabled.title: 是否禁止默认安装。
disabled.description:
Indicates whether the automatic installation of the component is disabled. By default, some optional components, such as components for logging and Ingresses, are installed when a cluster is created. You can set this parameter to disable automatic component installation. Valid values:

*   `true`: disables automatic component installation.
*   `false`: enables automatic component installation.

additionalProperties.description: The details of the standard components.

DescribeClusterAddonsVersion.summary: You can call the DescribeClusterAddonsVersion operation to query the details about all components in a cluster by cluster ID.

version.title: 组件当前版本
version.description:
The current version of the component.

>  If the value of `version` is not empty, it indicates that the component is installed.

next_version.title: 组件可升级版本
next_version.description: The version to which the component can be updated.

changed.title: 组件是否升级过。
changed.description:
Indicates whether the component is updated. Valid values:

*   `true`: The component is updated.
*   `false`: The component is not updated.

can_upgrade.title: 组件是否可以升级。
can_upgrade.description:
Indicates whether the component is updatable. Valid values:

*   `true`: The component is updatable.
*   `false`: The component is not updatable.

policy.title: 组件升级策略
policy.description:
The update policy of the component.

*   `overwrite`: The component configurations of the later version overwrite those of the current version.

Default value: `overwrite`.

ready_to_upgrade.title: 组件是否满足升级条件
ready_to_upgrade.description:
Indicates whether the component meets the update conditions. Valid values:

*   `true`: The component meets the update conditions.
*   `false`: The component does not meet the update conditions.

exist.title: 组件是否已经存在
exist.description:
Indicates whether the component can be installed in the specified ACK cluster. Valid values:

*   `true`: The component can be installed in the cluster.
*   `false`: The component cannot be installed in the cluster.

required.title: 组件是否为集群必需。
required.description:
Indicates whether the component is required in the cluster. Valid values:

*   `true`: The component is required in the cluster.
*   `false`: The component is not required in the cluster.

message.title: 组件描述信息
message.description: Additional information about whether the component is updatable.
message.example: Addons that detect node failures and report to event center.

DescribeClusterAddonInstance.summary: You can call the DescribeClusterAddonInstance operation to query the information about a cluster component, including the version, status, and configuration of the component.

state.title: 组件状态。
state.description:
The status of the component. Valid values:

*   initial: The component is being installed.
*   active: The component has been installed.
*   unhealthy: The component is in an abnormal state.
*   upgrading: The component is undergoing an upgrade.
*   updating: Component configuration changes are being applied.
*   deleting: The component is being uninstalled.
*   deleted: The component has been deleted.

DescribeClusterAddonsUpgradeStatus.summary: You can call the DescribeClusterAddonsUpgradeStatus operation to query the update progress of a component by component name.

items.description: The component name.

version.title: 组件版本
version.description: The current version of the component.

ready_to_upgrade.title: 组件是否满足升级条件
ready_to_upgrade.description:
Indicates whether the component meets the update conditions. Valid values:

*   `true`: The component meets the update conditions.
*   `false`: The component does not meet the update conditions.

tasks.title: 升级任务详情
tasks.description: The details of the update task.

created_at.title: 升级任务创建时间
created_at.description: The start time of the task.

finished_at.title: 升级任务完成时间
finished_at.description: The end time of the task.

status.title: 升级任务状态
status.description:
The status of the update task. Valid values:

*   `Upgrading`: The update task is in progress.
*   `Success`: The update task is successful.
*   `Failed`: The update task failed.
*   `Running`: The component is being installed.
*   `Paused`: The update task is paused.
*   `Canceled:` The update task is canceled.

is_canceled.title: 升级任务是否被取消。
is_canceled.description:
Indicates whether the update task is canceled. Valid values:

*   `true`: The update task is canceled.
*   `false`: The update task is not canceled.

additionalProperties.description: The details about the update progress of the components.

DescribeExternalAgent.summary: Queries the proxy configurations of a registered cluster by cluster ID.

schema.title: 是否获取内网访问凭据。  true：获取内网连接凭据 false：获取公网连接凭据 默认值：false。
schema.description:
Specifies whether to obtain the credentials that are used to access the cluster over the internal network.

*   `true`: obtains the credentials that are used to access the cluster over the internal network.
*   `false`: obtains the credentials that are used to access the cluster over the Internet.

Default value: `false`.

schema.title: agent模式
schema.description:
The permission mode of the agent. Valid values:

admin: the admin mode, which provides full permissions. restricted: the restricted mode, which provides partial permissions. Default value: admin.

config.title: 代理配置。
config.description: The agent configurations in the YAML format.

staticInfo.noSubstitutionReason: 无替代API，历史原因导致该API被标记为弃用。

DescribeExternalAgent.title: DescribeExternalAgent
DescribeExternalAgent.description: For more information, see [Register an external Kubernetes cluster](~~121053~~).

CreateKubernetesTrigger.summary: You can call the CreateKubernetesTrigger operation to create a trigger for an application.

project_id.title: 项目名称。
project_id.description:
The name of the trigger project.

The name consists of the namespace where the application is deployed and the name of the application. The format is `${namespace}/${name}`.

Example: `default/test-app`.

action.title: 触发器行为
action.description:
The action that the trigger performs. Set the value to redeploy.

`redeploy`: redeploys the resources specified by `project_id`.

type.title: 触发器类型。默认deployment。
type.description:
The type of trigger. Valid values:

*   `deployment`: performs actions on Deployments.
*   `application`: performs actions on applications that are deployed in Application Center.

Default value: `deployment`.

project_id.title: 触发器项目名称。
project_id.description: The name of the trigger project.

type.title: 触发器类型。默认值为 deployment 。
type.description:
The type of trigger.

Valid values:

*   `deployment`: performs actions on Deployments.
*   `application`: performs actions on applications that are deployed in Application Center.

action.title: 触发器行为。
action.description: The action that the trigger performs. For example, a value of `redeploy` indicates that the trigger redeploys the application.

CreateKubernetesTrigger.title: CreateKubernetesTrigger

GetKubernetesTrigger.summary: You can call the GetKubernetesTrigger operationto query the triggers of an application by application name.

schema.title: 应用类型。
schema.description:
The type of trigger. Valid values:

*   `deployment`: performs actions on Deployments.
*   `application`: performs actions on applications that are deployed in Application Center.

Default value: `deployment`.

If you do not set this parameter, triggers are not filtered by type.

schema.title: 触发器行为。
schema.description:
The action that the trigger performs. Set the value to redeploy.

`redeploy`: redeploys the resources specified by `project_id`.

If you do not specify this parameter, triggers are not filtered by action.

schema.title: 返回参数。
schema.description: The details of the triggers returned.

cluster_id.title: 集群ID
cluster_id.description: The ID of the associated cluster.

project_id.title: 触发器项目名称
project_id.description:
The name of the project.

The name consists of the namespace where the application is deployed and the name of the application. The format is `${namespace}/${name}`. Example: default/test-app.

type.title: 触发器类型。
type.description:
The type of trigger.

Valid values:

*   `deployment`: performs actions on Deployments.
*   `application`: performs actions on applications that are deployed in Application Center.

Default value: `deployment`.

action.title: 触发器行为
action.description:
The action that the trigger performs. The value is set to redeploy.

`redeploy`: redeploys the resource specified by project_id.

GetKubernetesTrigger.title: GetKubernetesTrigger

DescribeClusters.summary: Queries all the clusters that belong to the current Alibaba Cloud account, including Kubernetes clusters and Swarm clusters.

schema.description: The cluster name based on which the system performs fuzzy searches among the clusters that belong to the current Alibaba Cloud account.
schema.title: 集群名称。

clusters.description: The information about the clusters returned.

created.description: The time when the cluster was created.

security_group_id.description: The ID of the security group to which the cluster belongs.

master_url.description: The endpoints that are open for connections to the cluster. The endpoints include api_server_endpoint, dashboard_endpoint, mirana_endpoint, reverse_tunnel_endpoint, and intranet_api_server_endpoint. For more information, see [Use SSH to connect to a cluster](~~86491~~).

external_loadbalancer_id.description: The ID of the Server Load Balancer (SLB) instance that is associated with the cluster.

network_mode.description: The network type of the cluster. A value of vpc indicates that the cluster uses a virtual private cloud (VPC).

zone_id.description: The ID of the zone where the cluster is deployed.

deletion_protection.description: Indicates whether deletion protection is enabled for the cluster. If deletion protection is enabled, the cluster cannot be deleted by operations in the console or API operations.

current_version.description: The Kubernetes version of the cluster.

updated.description: The time when the cluster was last updated.

resource_group_id.description: The ID of the resource group to which the cluster belongs.

region_id.description: The region ID of the cluster.

vpc_id.description: The VPC ID of the cluster.

data_disk_size.description: The data disk size. Unit: GB.

state.description: The cluster status. Valid values: running, filed, and stopped. A value of running indicates that the cluster is running as expected. A value of filed or stopped indicates that the cluster is in the abnormal state.

size.description: The number of nodes in the cluster.

vswitch_cidr.description: The prefix length of the CIDR block that is assigned to the vSwitch.

data_disk_category.description: The category of the data disk.

deletion_protection.title: 集群是否开启删除保护。

private_zone.title: 集群是否开启Private Zone，默认false。

profile.title: 集群标识，区分是否为边缘托管版。

DescribeClusters.title: DescribeClusters
